title: Seven Layer Bars Recipe
description: These 7 layer bars are so easy to make, and so rich and delicious! You can use different nuts or baking chips (vanilla or peanut butter) to suit your taste.

Layer Bars 4.7 (686) 505 Reviews 69 Photos These 7 layer bars are easy to make, and very rich. You can use different kinds of chips (vanilla or peanut butter) to suit your taste. Submitted by P. Tindall Updated on January 10, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 69 69 69 69 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 36 Yield: 3 dozen bar cookies Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 36 servings ½ cup unsalted butter 1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips 1 cup butterscotch chips 1 cup chopped walnuts 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 ⅓ cups shredded coconut Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Put butter in 13x9-inch baking pan and place in oven until melted. Swirl to coat bottom and sides with butter. Spread graham cracker crumbs evenly over bottom of pan. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts over crumbs. Pour condensed milk over walnuts and sprinkle with coconut. Bake in preheated oven until edges are golden brown, about 25 minutes. Cool and cut into 36 bars. Melissa Goff I Made It Print 1,128 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 155 Calories 10g Fat 17g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 36 Calories 155 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 12% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 11mg 4% Sodium 49mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 17g 6% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 14g Protein 2g 4% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 38mg 3% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 96mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Seven Layer Bars 01 of 69 Photo by  Melissa Goff 02 of 69 Photo by  wkidd69 08/22/2023 Love the ingredients EXCEPT I would mix the graham crackers and butter first, then press into the pan. When I baked it the butter was separated somewhat from the rest of the layers, by following these directions. I baked another 5 mins then put in the freezer to quickly cook to see if it would be too gooey or runny and they seem to be ok. I like the way Buccees makes theirs. 03 of 69 Photo by  nfmarie1 03/05/2022 I took advice from reviews and made the crust in a bowl first, then formed into pan and put in the oven for 5min. I used 2c graham cracker crumbs and 1 stick of butter, which made the crust just the perfect amount of crispy. One variation I got alot of compliments on was using semisweet, milk chocolate and peanut butter chips (made half without coconut) then after removing it from the oven, sprinkled honey roasted peanuts on the half with no coconut...yum! Ive made this recipe 3 times in a week with 3 different combinations of toppings and all came out great 04 of 69 Photo by  Aaron B 12/05/2021 Just pulled the pan out of the oven. I wish you could smell them. Yum!. I used Mini Chocolate Chips this time and Pecans. 05 of 69 Photo by  Christina Smith 12/24/2020 06 of 69 Photo by  Sarah P 12/12/2020 07 of 69 Photo by  amanda kalligher 11/22/2020 08 of 69 Photo by  Launi 09/27/2020 09 of 69 Photo by  Wade Hudgins 08/24/2020 10 of 69 Photo by  Jenna Powers 06/06/2020 Delicious 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Apple Squares 1,537 Ratings Seven Layer Magic Bars 48 Ratings Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars 1,974 Ratings Magic Cookie Bars 244 Ratings Blueberry Crumb Bars 875 Ratings Apple Bars 250 Ratings Scrumptious Frosted Fudgy Brownies 166 Ratings Lime Bars 113 Ratings Blonde Brownies 1,945 Ratings Pumpkin Bars with Applesauce 2 Ratings No-Bake Chocolate Oatmeal Bars 14 Ratings Milly's Oatmeal Brownies 342 Ratings (Gluten Free) Magic Cookie Bars 67 Ratings Cherry Cheesecake Brownies 24 Ratings Chocolate Frosted Toffee Bars 10 Ratings Pumpkin Bars I 223 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: P. Tindall
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Put butter in 13x9-inch baking pan and place in oven until melted. Swirl to coat bottom and sides with butter.;Spread graham cracker crumbs evenly over bottom of pan. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts over crumbs. Pour condensed milk over walnuts and sprinkle with coconut.;Bake in preheated oven until edges are golden brown, about 25 minutes.;Cool and cut into 36 bars. Melissa Goff
